body.name: HOMCOM 6 Point Vibrating Massage Office Chair with Heat, Microfiber High Back Executive Office Chair with Reclining Backrest, Padded Armrests and Remote, Coffee
features: Feel Better After A Long Day: If you have issues with back pain from sitting all day, this executive office chair has a six-point vibration massage to reduce body fatigue, and lumbar heating to relax it away. Use the remote control to adjust between massage mode, intensity, timer, and heat setting.

Lean Back And Relax: When you're ready for a break, stretch back in this massaging office chair with a 125° backrest, or lean back and enjoy the tilt function, to take the pressure off your lower lumbar and spine.

All Day Comfort: This computer chair has a high-back that provides neck, back and lower lumbar support that will keep you comfortable for those long days. The padded armrests keep the pressure off your elbows for better support. Microfiber is breathable, soft to touch and means easy cleaning of TV snack spills.
Adjust Your Position: This comfy desk chair has adjustable seat height, which can be adjusted from 17.75" to 21.75", so you can match your desk and sitting preferences.
Comfortable Office Chair Information: Overall Dimensions: 25.5"W x 28"D x 43.25"-47.25"H, Seat Size: 20.5"W x 19.75"D x 17.75"-21.75"H, Weight Capacity: 264 lbs. Assembly required.
body.description: If you work from home or spends a lot of time in the office, you need a chair that's going to hold up if you're studying for a big final, or finishing on a big work project. This home office chair from HOMCOM can not only keep up, but goes above and beyond with its relaxing massaging features. Lay back and let this work chair help work out those painful stress knots in your back. Comfort and functionality are important for an office chair, and HOMCOM knows how to deliver. 6 vibration massage points with lumbar heating to relax your body; 3 intensities and 3 modes of massage and heat for the ultimate relaxation; Don't worry about falling asleep in the massaging with timer of 15min, 30min and 60min; Controlled by wired remote, with side pocket for storage; Take a break and stretch out with a max 125° recline angle and tilt function; Leather-like microfiber is easy to clean the TV snack spill; Adjustable seat height can match your desk or your sitting habit; Swivel wheels and seat ensure easy and quick mobility;

manufacturerProductDescription.media_text: Your home is your castle, and HOMCOM has what you need to live and relax in royal style. If you can think it, chances are we've got it. We've got you covered in the kitchen, dining room, living room, and beyond, in just about any style you're looking for. Houses are versatile, and we want to make your house feel like home. If you work from home or spends a lot of time in the office, you need a chair that's going to hold up if you're studying for a big final, or finishing on a big work project. This home office chair from HOMCOM can not only keep up, but goes above and beyond with its relaxing massaging features. Lay back and let this work chair help work out those painful stress knots in your back. Comfort and functionality are important for an office chair, and HOMCOM knows how to deliver. 6 vibration massage points with lumbar heating to relax your body; 3 intensities and 3 modes of massage and heat for the ultimate relaxation; Don't worry about falling asleep in the massaging with timer of 15min, 30min and 60min; Controlled by wired remote, with side pocket for storage; Take a break and stretch out with a max 125° recline angle and tilt function; Leather-like microfiber is easy to clean the TV snack spill; Adjustable seat height can match your desk or your sitting habit; Swivel wheels and seat ensure easy and quick mobility;

Color Coffee Material Microfiber Cloth (100% polyester), Foam, PU (wheel), Nylon (foot) Overall Dimension 25.5"W x 28"D x 43.25"-47.25"H Fully Reclined Size 25.5"W x 35.75"D x 40.25"-44"H Seat Size 20.5"W x 19.75"D x 17.75"-21.75"H Armrest Height to Floor 11"L x 3.25"W x 25.5"-29.5"H Backrest Size 28"L x 20.5"W x 4.75"D Power Cord Length 5.9ft Weight Capacity 264 lbs Input AC 100-240V, 50-60Hz, 0.5A Output DC 12V, 1A Item Label 921-171V85CF

Good Quality We use selected materials and qualified factories to produce our products, and each product has been checked many times throughout the production process to ensure that it is intact. Nice-looking We work hard to create popular, chic, and innovative items that can pass the test of time and help you live better. Versatile Use We create simple but unique designs to make our furniture blend perfectly with your home environment whether it's from your kitchen to your dining room, or from your bedroom to your living room. Everything in Order We dedicate to helping you keep everything well organized and try to offer you storage space as much as possible. Refresh your home immediately with the storage space we provided!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 11, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars LOVE this chair
reviews.reviewText: Got this as a gift for my mom- might have to get one for myself now! Really comfy- though could use some lumbar support. The seat is firm, but cushioned. The "massage" is just a basic vibration, you can have 3 modes (pulse, constant, or variable) and can have it vibrate the seat, lumbar, and upper back all separately. The heating takes a minute to warm up, but it's not so long that it's a problem, and the heat is very pleasant and consistent. The microfiber is surprisingly soft, and the hydraulics for the up and down and the recline as very smooth. The seat was VERY easy to put together with very basic instructions.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 6, 2024
reviews.reviewText: Didn't realize it was linen material but it's still cute. Massage works okay. Not top quality. The heat is good, feels nice on my back

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 21, 2014
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars A good chair - no complaints
reviews.reviewText: I was searching specifically for a massage chair, and the price attracted me to this one ($149 at the time). Let's put all our cards on the table though, this is not a shiatsu massage - it is a vibrating massage. And trust me, you can feel the difference. But, having said that, the price for the superior shiatsu massage chairs is prohibitive for me, so this is definitely second best.You can feel the vibrating in your upper thighs, lower back, and upper back between your shoulders. It feels just like if someone were to hold one of those vibrating wands to your back, but not move it around. It's not going to satisfy you as well as a moving massage, but it is better than nothing. I game for hours and this chair prevents my back from hurting.The chair was easy to assemble, included clear instructions, and everything worked out of the box. The remote has a simple monochrome liquid crystal display and does not feel cheap. It is responsive, even when the batteries are low. There is no battery strength indicator, but the display will turn from bold black to light black due to lack of battery strength.I like that the arms are padded, this prevents my elbows from getting sore while I use the keyboard. The chair isn't significantly plush, but it is comfortable nonetheless. Been using it daily for almost 2 months and has not broken or given me any problems. Only had to change the remote control batteries once, presumably because the included starter batteries are of low quality. A couple Duracell's in there should last awhile.I recommend this chair to someone that wants a massager, but can't afford a shiatsu.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 23, 2021
reviews.reviewTitle: 1.0 out of 5 stars No Butt Padding
reviews.reviewText: I bought this chair to replace my long, over-used gaming chair that is about 2 years old. I work from home and as a writer I spend a great deal of time in office chairs. I am also a decent sized fellow (6'2" 225lbs.) so I need some tushy cushion.After a lot of looking and research, I know a chair with a 200 pound weight limit isn't going to hold up. I also know that I use these chairs much longer than most other users (average 12-15 hours per day). So when I do shop, I look for sturdy wheels, great padding and high weight limit. That all led me to this chair. My mistake.This chair had 1 of 3. The wheels are nice, and the same that came on my Songmics gaming chair. However, while the padding looks plush and thick and the weight limit is high enough, nothing is really there.The lumbar support is decent, and the heating is nice. Cord management is a nightmare, and the immobile arms are alright, but nothing special.The real pain is that there is basically nothing where your butt goes. Extra padding high on the seat back and a big fluff in the middle of the seat - where no legs will ever rest. But where your thighs sit and most importantly where the buttocks go... nothing. My tailbone is sore, my cheeks are numb and I hate this chair.Not to mention after using it for 10 days, the hydraulic lift is already starting to sink, though not much, it is noticeable.Going from bad to worse, I can't even return it. Apparently the 17 days it took to ship (with Prime) and the week I owned it before making up my mind to stop using it, were enough to not warrant a return of any kind.Unless you are 5'3" and weigh less than 90 pounds, I'd shop for a different brand and model chair. This one is horrid.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on June 21, 2021
reviews.reviewTitle: 3.0 out of 5 stars Nice heat, nice massage, tends to suddenly fall backwards
reviews.reviewText: This chair is comfortable, and the heat and massage are great. I especially like the control over the areas of massage. The bright red clashes with the office decor, but it's good to be the boss. After three weeks the chair has started suddenly falling back as the lever that controls tilt works its way out. The sudden falling backwards is a problem. In another chair from another company, I had to have the lever spot-welded in place because even epoxy kept cracking and the chair kept suddenly falling back. I'd give 4.5 stars except for this problem.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 22, 2023
reviews.reviewText: Awesome chair, works perfect. Very comfortable. Massage feature is a bit loud but works great. Heater function is amazing.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 18, 2024
reviews.reviewText: I like it only thing is that it don’t go back it’s just reg the seat get warm and back but that’s it looking for recliner this ain’t it

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 6, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars A tad disappointed
reviews.reviewText: It's okay. You can't turn on just the heat or just the massage. I can't have the noise of the massage at work but my office gets chilly. Also, the cord isn't very long. It's comfy though!
Una silla ejecutiva que cumple más de las expectativas en relación costo precio el puro equipo de masaje vale mucho la pena
